a1: SERP stands for Search Engine Results Page. It is the page displayed by search engines in response to a search query, showing titles, URLs, and descriptions of matching pages.
q2: What is the ideal title tag length?
a2: Google typically displays the first 50-60 characters of a title tag. Titles longer than this may be truncated with an ellipsis in search results.
q3: Why does my search snippet look different than expected?
a3: Google may rewrite your title tag or meta description if it determines a different snippet would be more relevant to the search query. Writing clear, relevant meta tags reduces this likelihood.
